review.description:
This place is a great addition to the neighborhood.  While it's not much to look at inside, the food is inexpensive and delicious and the people who work there are really nice.

I got a bunch of Mexican food for a Thursday fiesta after work.  The chicken burrito was huge, with nicely cooked chicken, fresh black beans, and guac.  The quesadilla was really good, as well.

I saw a guy in there eating fried chicken with pork fried rice -- I'm gonna have to go back to try that combo.  The fried chicken looked temptingly enticing.

Considering how inexpensive this place is, you really can't complain.  It's great value for money!
review.author: John D.

review.description:
Simply....quality than quantity!
Not excellent but for the price, Curry Chicken with Onion ($5.75) was actually good. I chose fried rice (+50 cents). Sliced white meat were tender. Sliced green peppers, Chinese cabbage and for color, I believe, there were sliced carrots but it didn't work for me. Portion was good for two of my size.
review.author: Taiyo O.

review.description:
Pretty good food.

The proportions are amazing considering the price...especially for NY.
review.author: Sonia B.

review.description: You know, this is a typical Chinese/Mexican (but really Chinese) hole in the wall that you find all over NYC.  Is it truly good food?  No.  Is it a guilty pleasure?  Hell yes.  It's also pretty cheap and quick.
review.author: Brad K.

review.description: Disgusting and must be 3 times the normal amount of msg for an Americanized Chinese takeout dish.  Avoid the Chinese menu as at all costs.  I can't speak for the Tex-Mex one.
review.author: Kevin G.
